SEARCH

Class ArrayHelper

java.lang.Object
ArrayHelper
public class ArrayHelper extends Object
This ArrayHelper class has some array operations I wrote that are useful to image processing

    • Double2Int

      public static int[][][] Double2Int(double[][][] arr, int width, int height)
      Convert a 3D array of doubles into a 2D array of integers, the shape is always (3, width, height) as we only need to convert RGB colour images
      Parameters:
      arr - 3D double array (RGB colour image)
      width - arr's row number
      height - arr's column number
      Returns:
      int[][] 3D integer array (RGB colour image)

      Parameters:
      arr - source image (grayscale or one colour channel)
      width - arr's row number
      Returns:

    • CloneImage

      public static int[][] CloneImage(int[][] arr, int rStart, int rEnd, int cStart, int cEnd)
      Clones part of an image array (grayscale or one colour channel) corresponds to the area [rowStart, rowEnd), [colStart, colEnd) in the source image
      Parameters:
      arr - source image (grayscale or one colour channel)
      rStart - lower bound in rows (inclusive)
      rEnd - upper bound in rows (exclusive)
      cStart - lower bound in columns (inclusive)
      cEnd - upper bound in columns (exclusive)
      Returns:
      int[][] cloned array (of the specified area)

    • CloneImage

      public static int[][] CloneImage(int[][] arr, int rStart, int rEnd, int rLen, int cStart, int cEnd, int cLen)
      Clones part of an image array (grayscale or one colour channel) corresponds to the area [rowStart, rowEnd), [colStart, colEnd) in the source image
      Parameters:
      arr - source image (grayscale or one colour channel)
      rStart - lower bound in rows (inclusive)
      rEnd - upper bound in rows (exclusive)
      rLen - rEnd - rStart
      cStart - lower bound in columns (inclusive)
      cEnd - upper bound in columns (exclusive)
      cLen - cEnd - cStart
      Returns:
      int[][] cloned array (of the specified area)

    • CloneImage

      public static int[][][] CloneImage(int[][][] arr, int width)
      Clones an image array (colour image), the shape is always (3, width, height) as we only need to convert RGB colour images
      Parameters:
      arr - source image (colour image)
      width - arr's width (row number in each colour channel's 2D array)
      Returns:
      int[][][] cloned array

    • CloneImage

      public static int[][][] CloneImage(int[][][] arr, int rStart, int rEnd, int cStart, int cEnd)
      Clones part of an image array (colour image) corresponds to the area [rowStart, rowEnd), [colStart, colEnd) in the source image, the shape of source image is always (3, width, height) as we only need to convert RGB colour images
      Parameters:
      arr - source image (colour image)
      rStart - lower bound in rows (inclusive)
      rEnd - upper bound in rows (exclusive)
      cStart - lower bound in columns (inclusive)
      cEnd - upper bound in columns (exclusive)
      Returns:
      int[][][] cloned array (of the specified area)

    • NormalizeImg

      public static void NormalizeImg(int[][] img, int width, int height)
      Normalize a 2D array of integers to the range [0, 255], in place
      Parameters:
      img - an image (grayscale or one colour channel)
      width - arr's row number
      height - arr's column number

    • NormalizeToImg

      public static int[][] NormalizeToImg(double[][] arr, int width, int height, int cap)
      Normalize an array of doubles to an array of integers with range [0, cap], min-max normalization is used as it seems to be the most appropriate
      Parameters:
      arr - array of doubles
      width - arr's row number
      height - arr's column number
      cap - the cap (255 for 8-bit grayscale / 24-bit RGB colour images)
      Returns:
      int[][] normalized array of integers

    • NormalizeToImg

      public static int[][] NormalizeToImg(double[][] arr, int width, int height)
      Normalize an array of doubles to an array of integers with range [0, 255], min-max normalization is used as it seems to be the most appropriate
      Parameters:
      arr - array of doubles
      width - arr's row number
      height - arr's column number
      Returns:
      int[][] normalized array of integers

      Saves a grayscale image
      Parameters:
      norm - whether the pixel values should be normalized

    • RotationMatrix

      public static float[] RotationMatrix(double angle)
      Create a flattened rotation matrix that rotates vectors by an angle
      Parameters:
      angle - rotation angle (radian)
      Returns:
      float[] flattened version of the rotation matrix

    • GetCol

      public static int[] GetCol(int[][] arr, int col, int width)
      Get a column of a 2D array of integers, since Java's 2D int arrays are essentially arrays of arrays of primitive int, there is no built-in faster implementations to get a column for us
      Parameters:
      arr - the 2D array
      col - index
      width - the row number of arr
      Returns:
      int[] the column (arr[:][col])
